entries.meaning: The seating area at a stadium or arena; the bleachers.
The audience at a public event.

verbs.description: grandstand (third-person singular simple present grandstands, present participle grandstanding, simple past and past participle grandstanded)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To behave dramatically or showily to impress an audience or observers; to pander to a crowd.
examples: Many politicians prefer to grandstand on hot-button issues rather than enact tough policy changes.
